verses.kjv: And it came to pass on the second sabbath after the first, that he went through the corn fields; and his disciples plucked the ears of corn, and did eat, rubbing them in their hands.
verses.ct: On a Sabbath, Jesus was walking through some grain fields, and his disciples were picking heads of grain, rubbing them in their hands, and eating them.

verses.kjv: And certain of the Pharisees said unto them, Why do ye that which is not lawful to do on the sabbath days?
verses.ct: Some of the Pharisees asked, "Why are you doing something that isn't permitted on the Sabbath?"

verses.kjv: And Jesus answering them said, Have ye not read so much as this, what David did, when himself was an hungred, and they which were with him;
verses.ct: Jesus responded, "Haven't you even read what David did when he and his companions were hungry?

verses.kjv: How he went into the house of God, and did take and eat the shewbread, and gave also to them that were with him; which it is not lawful to eat but for the priests alone?
verses.ct: He entered God's house, took the sacred bread, and ate it — and shared it with those who were with him — even though only the priests were allowed to eat it."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, That the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath.
verses.ct: Then he told them, "The Son of Man has authority over the Sabbath."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass also on another sabbath, that he entered into the synagogue and taught: and there was a man whose right hand was withered.
verses.ct: On a different Sabbath, he went into the synagogue and was teaching. A man was there whose right hand was shriveled up.

verses.kjv: And the scribes and Pharisees watched him, whether he would heal on the sabbath day; that they might find an accusation against him.
verses.ct: The religious scholars and Pharisees were watching Jesus closely to see if he would heal on the Sabbath, so they could have something to accuse him of.

verses.kjv: But he knew their thoughts, and said to the man which had the withered hand, Rise up, and stand forth in the midst. And he arose and stood forth.
verses.ct: But he already knew what they were thinking. He said to the man with the shriveled hand, "Get up and stand here in front of everyone." So the man got up and stood there.

verses.kjv: Then said Jesus unto them, I will ask you one thing; Is it lawful on the sabbath days to do good, or to do evil? to save life, or to destroy it?
verses.ct: Jesus said to them, "Let me ask you something: Is it permitted on the Sabbath to do good or to do harm? To save a life or to destroy one?"

verses.kjv: And looking round about upon them all, he said unto the man, Stretch forth thy hand. And he did so: and his hand was restored whole as the other.
verses.ct: He looked around at all of them, then said to the man, "Stretch out your hand." The man did, and his hand was completely restored, just like the other one.

verses.kjv: And they were filled with madness; and communed one with another what they might do to Jesus.
verses.ct: They were furious and began discussing with each other what they could do to Jesus.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in those days, that he went out into a mountain to pray, and continued all night in prayer to God.
verses.ct: During that time, Jesus went up on a mountain to pray, and he spent the entire night praying to God.

verses.kjv: And when it was day, he called unto him his disciples: and of them he chose twelve, whom also he named apostles;
verses.ct: When morning came, he called his disciples together and selected 12 of them, whom he designated as apostles:

verses.kjv: Simon, (whom he also named Peter,) and Andrew his brother, James and John, Philip and Bartholomew,
verses.ct: Simon (whom he also named Peter), his brother Andrew, James, John, Philip, Bartholomew,

verses.kjv: Matthew and Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon called Zelotes,
verses.ct: Matthew, Thomas, James son of Alphaeus, Simon who was called the Zealot,

verses.kjv: And Judas the brother of James, and Judas Iscariot, which also was the traitor.
verses.ct: Judas son of James, and Judas Iscariot, who would later betray him.

verses.kjv: And he came down with them, and stood in the plain, and the company of his disciples, and a great multitude of people out of all Judaea and Jerusalem, and from the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon, which came to hear him, and to be healed of their diseases;
verses.ct: Jesus came down with them and stood on a level area. A large crowd of his disciples was there, along with a huge number of people from all over Judea, Jerusalem, and the coastal region of Tyre and Sidon. They had come to listen to him and to be healed of their illnesses.

verses.kjv: And they that were vexed with unclean spirits: and they were healed.
verses.ct: Those who were tormented by evil spirits were also cured.

verses.kjv: And the whole multitude sought to touch him: for there went virtue out of him, and healed them all.
verses.ct: The entire crowd was trying to touch him, because power was flowing out from him and healing everyone.

verses.kjv: And he lifted up his eyes on his disciples, and said, Blessed be ye poor: for yours is the kingdom of God.
verses.ct: Jesus looked at his disciples and said, "How blessed are you who are poor, because the kingdom of God belongs to you.

verses.kjv: Blessed are ye that hunger now: for ye shall be filled. Blessed are ye that weep now: for ye shall laugh.
verses.ct: How blessed are you who are hungry now, because you will be satisfied. How blessed are you who weep now, because you will laugh.

verses.kjv: Blessed are ye, when men shall hate you, and when they shall separate you from their company, and shall reproach you, and cast out your name as evil, for the Son of man’s sake.
verses.ct: How blessed are you when people hate you, exclude you, insult you, and reject your name as evil because of the Son of Man.

verses.kjv: Rejoice ye in that day, and leap for joy: for, behold, your reward is great in heaven: for in the like manner did their fathers unto the prophets.
verses.ct: Celebrate on that day and jump for joy! Look — your reward in heaven is great! Their ancestors treated the prophets the same way.

verses.kjv: But woe unto you that are rich! for ye have received your consolation.
verses.ct: But how terrible for you who are rich, because you've already received all the comfort you're going to get.

verses.kjv: Woe unto you that are full! for ye shall hunger. Woe unto you that laugh now! for ye shall mourn and weep.
verses.ct: How terrible for you who are well-fed now, because you will go hungry. How terrible for you who laugh now, because you will grieve and cry.

verses.kjv: Woe unto you, when all men shall speak well of you! for so did their fathers to the false prophets.
verses.ct: How terrible for you when everyone speaks highly of you, because that's exactly how their ancestors treated the false prophets.

verses.kjv: But I say unto you which hear, Love your enemies, do good to them which hate you,
verses.ct: But to those of you who are listening, I say this: Love your enemies. Treat those who hate you with kindness.

verses.kjv: Bless them that curse you, and pray for them which despitefully use you.
verses.ct: Speak well of those who curse you, and pray for those who mistreat you.

verses.kjv: And unto him that smiteth thee on the one cheek offer also the other; and him that taketh away thy cloak forbid not to take thy coat also.
verses.ct: If someone strikes you on one cheek, offer the other one as well. If someone takes your coat, don't stop them from taking your shirt too.

verses.kjv: Give to every man that asketh of thee; and of him that taketh away thy goods ask them not again.
verses.ct: Give to everyone who asks you, and if someone takes what belongs to you, don't demand it back.

verses.kjv: And as ye would that men should do to you, do ye also to them likewise.
verses.ct: Treat others the same way you want them to treat you.

verses.kjv: For if ye love them which love you, what thank have ye? for sinners also love those that love them.
verses.ct: If you only love people who love you back, what credit is that to you? Even sinners love those who love them.

verses.kjv: And if ye do good to them which do good to you, what thank have ye? for sinners also do even the same.
verses.ct: If you only do good to those who do good to you, what credit is that to you? Sinners do that much.

verses.kjv: And if ye lend to them of whom ye hope to receive, what thank have ye? for sinners also lend to sinners, to receive as much again.
verses.ct: If you only lend to people you expect to pay you back, what credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners, expecting full repayment.

verses.kjv: But love ye your enemies, and do good, and lend, hoping for nothing again; and your reward shall be great, and ye shall be the children of the Highest: for he is kind unto the unthankful and to the evil.
verses.ct: Instead, love your enemies, do good, and lend without expecting anything in return. Your reward will be great, and you will be children of the Most High, because he is kind to the ungrateful and the wicked.

verses.kjv: Be ye therefore merciful, as your Father also is merciful.
verses.ct: Show mercy, just as your Father shows mercy.

verses.kjv: Judge not, and ye shall not be judged: condemn not, and ye shall not be condemned: forgive, and ye shall be forgiven:
verses.ct: Don't judge others, and you won't be judged. Don't condemn others, and you won't be condemned. Forgive others, and you will be forgiven.

verses.kjv: Give, and it shall be given unto you; good measure, pressed down, and shaken together, and running over, shall men give into your bosom. For with the same measure that ye mete withal it shall be measured to you again.
verses.ct: Give generously, and it will be given back to you — packed down, shaken together, and overflowing, poured right into your lap. Whatever standard you use to measure will be the standard used to measure you in return."

verses.kjv: And he spake a parable unto them, Can the blind lead the blind? shall they not both fall into the ditch?
verses.ct: He also told them an illustration: "Can a blind person guide another blind person? Won't they both end up falling into a pit?

verses.kjv: The disciple is not above his master: but every one that is perfect shall be as his master.
verses.ct: A student isn't above the teacher, but everyone who is fully trained will become like their teacher.

verses.kjv: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother’s eye, but perceivest not the beam that is in thine own eye?
verses.ct: Why do you notice the tiny speck in your brother's eye but fail to see the wooden plank in your own eye?

verses.kjv: Either how canst thou say to thy brother, Brother, let me pull out the mote that is in thine eye, when thou thyself beholdest not the beam that is in thine own eye? Thou hypocrite, cast out first the beam out of thine own eye, and then shalt thou see clearly to pull out the mote that is in thy brother’s eye.
verses.ct: How can you say to your brother, 'Brother, let me remove that speck from your eye,' when you can't even see the plank in your own eye? You hypocrite! First remove the plank from your own eye, and then you'll be able to see clearly enough to remove the speck from your brother's eye.

verses.kjv: For a good tree bringeth not forth corrupt fruit; neither doth a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.
verses.ct: A healthy tree doesn't produce rotten fruit, and a rotten tree doesn't produce healthy fruit.

verses.kjv: For every tree is known by his own fruit. For of thorns men do not gather figs, nor of a bramble bush gather they grapes.
verses.ct: Every tree is identified by the fruit it produces. You don't pick figs from thornbushes, and you don't harvest grapes from brier patches.

verses.kjv: A good man out of the good treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is good; and an evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is evil: for of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaketh.
verses.ct: A good person produces good things from the goodness stored in their heart, and an evil person produces evil things from the evil stored in their heart. Whatever fills your heart is what your mouth will speak.

verses.kjv: And why call ye me, Lord, Lord, and do not the things which I say?
verses.ct: Why do you call me 'Lord, Lord,' but don't actually do what I tell you?

verses.kjv: Whosoever cometh to me, and heareth my sayings, and doeth them, I will shew you to whom he is like:
verses.ct: Everyone who comes to me, hears my words, and puts them into practice — let me show you what that person is like.

verses.kjv: He is like a man which built an house, and digged deep, and laid the foundation on a rock: and when the flood arose, the stream beat vehemently upon that house, and could not shake it: for it was founded upon a rock.
verses.ct: That person is like someone building a house who dug deep and set the foundation on solid rock. When a flood came and the rushing water slammed against that house, it couldn't be shaken, because it was built on rock.

verses.kjv: But he that heareth, and doeth not, is like a man that without a foundation built an house upon the earth; against which the stream did beat vehemently, and immediately it fell; and the ruin of that house was great.
verses.ct: But the person who hears my words and doesn't act on them is like someone who built a house directly on the ground with no foundation. When the rushing water slammed against it, the house collapsed instantly, and the destruction was devastating."
